p.s: youYou asked me in your previous email about the article and what School B goes green is.
As you know, I am a student at the School B and I actually took part in the project School B goes green.
So the article is written by Joachim Neubauer and was published on the 19th November in 2019, in the Kölner Stadtanzeiger a newspaper.
The article starts with questions concerning sustainability and ways to lifelive a green-lifestylegreen lifestyle.
Then the journalist describes that my school thought about possible ways to do something for the environment and life sustainable and that is why we founded the programm School B goes green.
This is a day where everyone has a free day to take part in workshops which students and teachers concipated and planned concerning certain aspects of sustainability.
He describes this day in 2019 and gives background information how this project came into life.
In the last years the teachers noticed that the students were interested in changing their lifestyle and becoming more sustainable, especially through Fridays for Future.
Then he quotes my teacher Mr Smith who says that many students took part in the movement.
Also in our schoolcouncilschool council, from the students, was interested in environment and clima protection, that is why they invented this day.
To empower our engagement and interest towards this topic.
Then the journalist goes over some of the workshops and ideas.
For example there were workshops to learn about a sustainable use of water, foodsharing, a secondhandsecond-hand flewmarketflea market etc.
Then we had an interview with two students who ran a fairtrade café, meaning they sold vegan waffles and fairtrade cakes to show taht vegan and sustainable products also taste good.
Additionally the author talks about two poetry-slammerspoetry slammers who visited our school and a workshop about writing and why your performance is very important.
The poetry slammers and the students wrote critical poetry about the laws and climate change.
They also wanted to teach the children how the performance influences your position if you have a debattedebate about climate.
In the end he summarizes the enthusiasm of the students and that we willl repeat this day.
So that was it.
I think he explained and described the project pretty good.
